excise.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the government tax that is put on the goods that are produced and used inside a country
excise.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to remove or get rid of something, especially by cutting it out
excise.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a government tax that is charged on certain goods that are sold in the country, for example alcoholic drinks and petrol
excise.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: An excise on home production of tobacco could have produced the same revenue as a tax on imports.
The Chancellor decided not to increase excise on whisky.
an excise officer  (=someone who collects excise)
excise.translation[2].definitions[1].def: in Britain, a group of government officials whose job is to collect excise and some other taxes
